title: Crypto fallout, Netflix bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, Apple AI leadership change
summary: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) had its worst day since March. The fallout has been pretty dramatic, especially for one company - Strategy (MSTR). Reuters have reported that Netflix (NFLX) has made a mostly cash offer for Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). Apple (AAPL) has replaced its AI chief. Amar Subramanya is its new vice president of AI. He steps into the role as John Giannandrea prepares to retire next spring. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

title: Tech Weekly: Samsung's foldable play, robot chef serves up meals
summary: STORY: From Samsung's new foldable phone... to robots serving up Thanksgiving meals.This is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklySamsung unveiled its first multi-folding smartphone - the Galaxy Z TriFold.It part of the South Koreans giant's efforts to shore up its position in a phone market sector where Chinese rivals have gained ground.The device is priced at around $2,440 and some analysts believe this, plus production challenges, means foldable phones won't yet become big sellers.Apple named veteran researcher Amar Subramanya as its vice president of artificial intelligence.He replaces John Giannandrea and takes over at a time where analysts see Apple as behind in the AI race.The firm has been slow to add AI features to its products compared to rivals like Samsung.There were reports Apple CEO Tim Cook was losing confidence in Giannandrea's ability to execute on product development.A robot chef served Thanksgiving meals to U.S. soldiers in South Korea.Troops ordered from a digital kiosk as robotic arms stirred, cooked and plated up.Army officials said the robot frees cooks for tactical field duties while maintaining food service on base.Tech firm Goodbytz built the robotic kitchen and said the system can run around the clock.South Korea's Coupang apologised for a massive data breach of 33.7 million customer accounts.Authorities said they're looking into whether the firm broke safety rules regarding personal information protection.The country's biggest online retailer is described as South Korea's equivalent of Amazon.com.The Coupang incident is the latest in a series of data leaks at major South Korean companies.And Apple's founding document is due to head for auction early next year.Auction house Christie's estimates bids to reach between $2 million and $4 million.The three-page document was signed in 1976 and carries the signatures of the company's three founders.Those include a then 21-year-old Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Ron Wayne.

raw.headline: Tech Weekly: Samsung's foldable play, robot chef serves up meals
raw.summary: STORY: From Samsung's new foldable phone... to robots serving up Thanksgiving meals.This is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklySamsung unveiled its first multi-folding smartphone - the Galaxy Z TriFold.It part of the South Koreans giant's efforts to shore up its position in a phone market sector where Chinese rivals have gained ground.The device is priced at around $2,440 and some analysts believe this, plus production challenges, means foldable phones won't yet become big sellers.Apple named veteran researcher Amar Subramanya as its vice president of artificial intelligence.He replaces John Giannandrea and takes over at a time where analysts see Apple as behind in the AI race.The firm has been slow to add AI features to its products compared to rivals like Samsung.There were reports Apple CEO Tim Cook was losing confidence in Giannandrea's ability to execute on product development.A robot chef served Thanksgiving meals to U.S. soldiers in South Korea.Troops ordered from a digital kiosk as robotic arms stirred, cooked and plated up.Army officials said the robot frees cooks for tactical field duties while maintaining food service on base.Tech firm Goodbytz built the robotic kitchen and said the system can run around the clock.South Korea's Coupang apologised for a massive data breach of 33.7 million customer accounts.Authorities said they're looking into whether the firm broke safety rules regarding personal information protection.The country's biggest online retailer is described as South Korea's equivalent of Amazon.com.The Coupang incident is the latest in a series of data leaks at major South Korean companies.And Apple's founding document is due to head for auction early next year.Auction house Christie's estimates bids to reach between $2 million and $4 million.The three-page document was signed in 1976 and carries the signatures of the company's three founders.Those include a then 21-year-old Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Ron Wayne.

title: Apple's AI chief steps down as company falls behind in tech race
summary: Apple's head of artificial intelligence and machine learning has stepped down from the company.  John Giannandrea, the current senior vice president for machine Learning and AI strategy, will be replaced by former Microsoft AI executive Amar Subramanya.  Mr Subramanya has overseen the development of Gemini, Google's AI and spent two decades in the industry.

raw.headline: Apple's AI chief steps down as company falls behind in tech race
raw.summary: Apple's head of artificial intelligence and machine learning has stepped down from the company.  John Giannandrea, the current senior vice president for machine Learning and AI strategy, will be replaced by former Microsoft AI executive Amar Subramanya.  Mr Subramanya has overseen the development of Gemini, Google's AI and spent two decades in the industry.

title: Samsung’s Next Salvo Against Apple: A Triple-Folding Smartphone
summary: SEOUL—The U.S. will soon get its first mass-market smartphone that folds not just once, but twice.  Samsung  Electronics’ Galaxy Z TriFold is expected to hit the shelves in the U.S. as early as the first quarter of 2026, after it goes on sale in South Korea and elsewhere this month.  The new phone is the latest salvo in Samsung’s long-running battle with  Apple  which is expected to introduce its own foldable phone—likely a once-folding model—later next year.

raw.headline: Samsung’s Next Salvo Against Apple: A Triple-Folding Smartphone
raw.summary: SEOUL—The U.S. will soon get its first mass-market smartphone that folds not just once, but twice.  Samsung  Electronics’ Galaxy Z TriFold is expected to hit the shelves in the U.S. as early as the first quarter of 2026, after it goes on sale in South Korea and elsewhere this month.  The new phone is the latest salvo in Samsung’s long-running battle with  Apple  which is expected to introduce its own foldable phone—likely a once-folding model—later next year.

title: Apple to Revamp AI Team After Announcing Top Executive’s Departure
summary: Apple  is shaking up its AI ranks, poaching a  Microsoft  executive and reorganizing after announcing the retirement of its top AI leader, whose tenure was defined by the company’s artificial-intelligence struggles.  John Giannandrea,  the iPhone maker’s senior vice president in charge of AI strategy, who had reported directly to Chief Executive  Tim Cook,  is stepping down, the company announced on Monday, and his duties will be split among other senior vice presidents responsible for software engineering, services and operations.  Amar Subramanya, who helped oversee Google’s Gemini chatbot before decamping to Microsoft earlier this year, will join Apple as vice president of AI, one rung lower than where Giannandrea was in the organization chart.

raw.headline: Apple to Revamp AI Team After Announcing Top Executive’s Departure
raw.summary: Apple  is shaking up its AI ranks, poaching a  Microsoft  executive and reorganizing after announcing the retirement of its top AI leader, whose tenure was defined by the company’s artificial-intelligence struggles.  John Giannandrea,  the iPhone maker’s senior vice president in charge of AI strategy, who had reported directly to Chief Executive  Tim Cook,  is stepping down, the company announced on Monday, and his duties will be split among other senior vice presidents responsible for software engineering, services and operations.  Amar Subramanya, who helped oversee Google’s Gemini chatbot before decamping to Microsoft earlier this year, will join Apple as vice president of AI, one rung lower than where Giannandrea was in the organization chart.

title: Apple names Amar Subramanya new VP of AI, replacing John Giannandrea
summary: Apple on Monday named veteran researcher Amar ​Subramanya as its vice president of AI,‌ replacing John Giannandrea.  Apple — a laggard in the AI ‌race — has been slow to add AI features to its products in comparison to rivals such as Samsung Electronics, which have been quicker ⁠to refresh their ‌devices with AI features.  Subramanya will lead critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models,‍ ML research and will report to software chief Craig Federighi.

Subramanya will lead critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models,‍ ML research and will report to software chief Craig Federighi.

title: John Giannandrea to retire from Apple
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., December 01, 2025--Apple® today announced John Giannandrea, Apple’s senior vice president for Machine Learning and AI Strategy, is stepping down from his position and will serve as an advisor to the company before retiring in the spring of 2026. Apple also announced that renowned AI researcher Amar Subramanya has joined Apple as vice president of AI, reporting to Craig Federighi. Subramanya will be leading critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models, ML research, and AI

title: Is Apple’s Stock Still a Good Bet After 14.4% Rally in 2025?
summary: Wondering if Apple stock is a bargain or priced for perfection? You're not alone. Getting to the bottom of its true value takes a closer look than headlines provide. Apple's shares are up 1.1% over the past week, 3.1% over the past month, and have gained an impressive 14.4% year-to-date, hinting at both resilience and optimism among investors. Tech sector momentum and ongoing innovation hype have kept Apple in the spotlight. New product rumors and regulatory headlines have also added fuel to...
